Articles.Content:
I again have returned to ask for Squad to please make the insane pylon length on the Goliath be variable as currently the current length is rediculous. Though I can see how some people might like that length and changing it might break older crafts, so instead I suggest you allow the length to very and be adjustable to everyone's desires. Although another alternative is to add a version of the Goliath with no pylon instead.

Just my thoughts anyway.

Have a google of A380 engine and 747 engine. Look how far forwards of the wing those engines sit... the Goliath engine pylon isn't "rediculous" at all. It is accurate.

Also, see this thread

12 hours ago, MR L A said:

Have a google of A380 engine and 747 engine. Look how far forwards of the wing those engines sit... the Goliath engine pylon isn't "rediculous" at all. It is accurate.

Also, see this thread 

 

It’s still undesirable and frankly too long for the fat-a55 wing. The fact there’s another thread for it proves I’m not the only one who thinks it’s too big. Whether it’s to scale to the real engines or not.

...or how about they give us a 2.5m engine, intake, fuselage, and pylon as separate parts.  You know.  Like they did for the 1.25m parts.

The entire line of model kit plane parts were a disappointment.  More lego.  Less model kit.

7 hours ago, ZooNamedGames said:

The fact there’s another thread for it proves I’m not the only one who thinks it’s too big

Whilst that is true, it somewhat misses the point that more people think you're wrong, at least in terms of Pylon length.

I do agree that the whole engine is a bit too big for the other parts in the game though
